titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Charles Easton Rothwell papers, 1924-1995
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Aparna Mukherjee; revised by Elizabeth Phillips

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-05-26T15:16-0700

physdesc.extent: 75 manuscript boxes, 2 oversize boxes, 10 envelopes, 1 album, 5 maps, 9 sound cassettes

did.abstract: Writings, correspondence, memoranda, reports, printed matter, photographs, and sound recordings relating to the United Nations, American foreign policy (especially in Asia), promotion of the study of international relations, and administration and activities of the Hoover Institution, Stanford University, Mills College, the Asia Foundation, and the National War College.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p:
Boxes are stored off site; a minimum of two days notice is required for use. Boxes may be requested through Stanford's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu
The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Charles Easton Rothwell papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1990.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/ Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Denver, Colorado
A.B., Reed College, Portland, Oregon
Director, Teacher Training in Social Sciences, University of Oregon
A.M., University of Oregon
Author (with Alfred N. Lomax), An Economic Geography of the Oregon Region
Married Virginia Sterling, Santa Monica, California
Instructor, Citizenship and History, Stanford University
Ph.D., Stanford University
Assistant Professor, History, and Advisor, Reed College
Worked with the Department of State, United States Government
Contributor, "War and Economic Institutions," War as a Social Institution, American Historical Association
Executive Secretary, United Nations Conference International Organization, San Francisco, California
Secretary General, U.S. delegation to United Nations
Senior staff member, Brookings Institution
Vice Chairman and Research Professor, Hoover Institution and Library

eventgrp.event: Contributor, "International Organization and World Politics," International Organization, Vol. III
Contributor, "International Relations in a World of Change," World Politics
Contributor, The Policy Sciences, edited by Daniel Lerner and Harold Lasswell

chronitem.event: Author (with H. D. Laswell and D. Lerner), A Comparative Study of Elites
Director, Hoover Institution
Contributor, "Europe in the Post War Period," Introduction to International Relations
President, Mills College, Oakland, California
Died, Marin County, California

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Writings, correspondence, memoranda, reports, printed matter, photographs, and sound recordings relating to the United Nations, American foreign policy (especially in Asia), promotion of the study of international relations, and administration and activities of the Hoover Institution, Stanford University, Mills College, the Asia Foundation, and the National War College.

controlaccess.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace.
United Nations Conference on International Organization (1945 : San Francisco, Calif.)
controlaccess.subject: Education.
International education.
Universities and colleges--United States.
World War, 1939-1945--United States.
World War, 1939-1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes applications and registration forms, biographical notes, brochures, bulletins, certificates, clippings, correspondence, financial records, flyers, interview, invitations, list of charitable contributions made in the memory of Charles Easton Rothwell, membership records, memoranda, minutes of meeting, notes, pamphlets, press releases, printed matter and articles written about Rothwell, and records relating to his involvement in the community, as well as the poems written by him and others, arranged alphabetically by physical form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes letters written to and by Virginia Rothwell.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters, arranged alphabetically by correspondent. Includes letters neither from nor to Charles Easton Rothwell.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brochures, bulletins, clippings, correspondence, colloquium, faculty records, financial records, memoranda, minutes of meetings, newsletters, printed matter, reports, schedule, telegrams, and travel information relating to the years of Charles Rothwell's service to Stanford University and the Hoover Institution, arranged alphabetically by physical form. Also includes the materials from various conferences and seminars he participated in at Stanford, California, and in Cambridge, England. See also: General Subject File and United Nations and State Department series.

scopecontent.p: Held at Stanford University unless otherwise stated.

Western College Congress and Pacific Northwest College Congress
Address, delivered by Ralph J. Bunche,
United States Interests in European Security
Committee on Pacific and Asiatic Studies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Brochures, bulletins, commencement records, correspondence, curriculum, financial records, list of alumnae clubs, memoranda, minutes of meetings, newsletters, pamphlets, printed matter, reports, speeches, statements, and telegrams relating to Charles Rothwell's years at Mills College as its eighth President, arranged alphabetically by physical form. Also includes the records of the involvement of Mills College in the community (the city of Oakland) under his leadership; his presidential household inventory and gift items; cultural events at Mills College during his tenure; the elaborate selection process by which the presidential selection committee selected Charles Rothwell as the President; his trips across the United States to visit the alumnae clubs; and above all, the dedication of Rothwell College Center as a tribute to the Rothwells for their significant contribution to the development of Mills College as a leading educational institution for women in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note

See also: Incremental Materials and Declassified U.S. Government Records series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: 141 prints, 13 contact sheets, and 1 album depicting Charles Easton Rothwell with his family and others, United Nations meetings and staff at work, Edward J. Stettinus signing the U.N. Charter, various U.N. projects in different countries, the President's House at Mills College, and the Virginia and Charles Rothwell College Center honoring the Rothwells for their contribution to the growth and development of Mills College and to women's education in the United States.

23 prints of United Nations meetings and of staff at work,

Roosevelt with others; 1 print of Elmer D. Fagan; 3 prints and 1 contact sheet of the Ninety-eighth commencement of the University of California, Berkeley; and 1 print of Avrshire Farm from the Santa Clara County atlas.
